Package com.github.siroshun09.event4j.bus

Interface EventBus<E>

Type Parameters:
E - the top-level event type
public interface EventBus<E>
An event bus to dispatch events.

      @Contract(value="-> new", pure=true) @NotNull static @NotNull EventBus<Event> create()
      Creates a new EventBus.

      The top-level event type is Event.

      Returns:
      a new EventBus

    • create

      @Contract(value="_ -> new", pure=true) @NotNull static @NotNull EventBus<Event> create(@NotNull @NotNull Executor asyncExecutor)
      Creates a new EventBus with the specified Executor.

      The top-level event type is Event.

      Parameters:
      asyncExecutor - the Executor to call events asynchronously
      Returns:
      a new EventBus

    • getSubscribers

      @NotNull @NotNull @UnmodifiableView Collection<EventSubscriber<?>> getSubscribers()
      Gets the collection of subscribed EventSubscribers.

      Included in this collection are subscribers to events in which getSubscriber(Class) has been called at least once.

      Returns:
      the collection of subscribed EventSubscribers

      @NotNull @NotNull @UnmodifiableView List<SubscribedListener<?>> subscribeAll(@NotNull @NotNull Key key, @NotNull @NotNull MultipleListeners listeners)
      Subscribes multiple listeners.
      Parameters:
      key - the key that subscribed listeners
      listeners - the MultipleListeners to subscribe
      Returns:
      the subscribed listeners
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if this event bus is already closed
      IllegalStateException - the MultipleListeners is already subscribed

      <T extends E> boolean unsubscribe(@NotNull @NotNull SubscribedListener<T> subscribedListener)
      Unsubscribes the listener.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of event
      Parameters:
      subscribedListener - the SubscribedListener to unsubscribe
      Returns:
      if the listener has been unsubscribed, returns true, otherwise false
      See Also:

    • unsubscribeAll

      void unsubscribeAll(@NotNull @NotNull List<SubscribedListener<?>> subscribedListeners)
      Unsubscribes the listeners.

      This method attempts to unsubscribe with EventSubscriber.unsubscribe(SubscribedListener) if the event class of the SubscribedListener is appropriate.

      Parameters:
      subscribedListeners - the listeners to unsubscribe

    • unsubscribeAll

      @Deprecated(since="3.1.0", forRemoval=true) void unsubscribeAll(@NotNull @NotNull MultipleListeners listeners)
      Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
      will be removed in 3.2.0, use other methods to unsubscribe (such as unsubscribe(SubscribedListener), unsubscribeAll(List) or unsubscribeAll(Key))
      Unsubscribes multiple listeners.
      Parameters:
      listeners - the MultipleListeners to unsubscribe
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if this event bus is already closed
      IllegalStateException - the MultipleListeners is not subscribed
      See Also:
      • MultipleListeners

    • unsubscribeAll

      void unsubscribeAll(@NotNull @NotNull Key key)
      Unsubscribes all listeners subscribed with the specified Key for this event bus instance.
      Parameters:
      key - the key that subscribed listeners
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if this event bus is already closed

    • unsubscribeIf

      void unsubscribeIf(@NotNull @NotNull Predicate<SubscribedListener<?>> predicate)
      Unsubscribes all listeners that satisfy the given Predicate.
      Parameters:
      predicate - a predicate which returns true for listeners to be unsubscribed
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if this event bus is already closed

    • callEvent

      @NotNull <T extends E> T callEvent(@NotNull T event)
      Dispatches the event to subscribed listeners.

      If an exception is thrown while calling a listener, Listener.handleException(Object, Throwable) is called and then continues to call the other listeners. That is, if a listener throws an exception, the method is processed to complete successfully.

      This method also dispatches to listeners of the higher class of the given event.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the event type
      Parameters:
      event - the event instance
      Returns:
      the given event instance
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if this event bus is already closed

    • callEventAsync

      @NotNull <T extends E> @NotNull CompletableFuture<T> callEventAsync(@NotNull T event)
      Calls callEvent(Object) asynchronously.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the event type
      Parameters:
      event - the event instance
      Returns:
      the CompletableFuture to get the given event instance
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if this event bus is already closed

    • callEventAsync

      @NotNull <T extends E> @NotNull CompletableFuture<T> callEventAsync(@NotNull T event, @NotNull @NotNull Executor executor)
      Calls callEvent(Object) asynchronously.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the event type
      Parameters:
      event - the event instance
      executor - the executor to call callEvent(Object)
      Returns:
      the CompletableFuture to get the given event instance
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if this event bus is already closed

    • callEventAsync

      @NotNull <T extends E> @NotNull CompletableFuture<T> callEventAsync(@NotNull T event, @NotNull @NotNull Function<Supplier<T>,CompletableFuture<T>> futureFunction)
      Calls callEvent(Object) asynchronously.

      The Supplier of the input of the Function is () -> callEvent(event), and the event will be called when Supplier.get() is executed.

      In callEventAsync(Object, Executor), the Supplier is used as supplier -> CompletableFuture.supplyAsync(supplier, executor) to create the required Function.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the event type
      Parameters:
      event - the event instance
      futureFunction - the function to create CompletableFuture
      Returns:
      the CompletableFuture to get the given event instance
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if this event bus is already closed

    • close

      void close()
      Closes this event bus.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if this event bus is already closed

    • isClosed

      boolean isClosed()
      Checks if this event bus is closed.
      Returns:
      if this event bus is closed, returns true, otherwise false

    • addResultConsumer

      boolean addResultConsumer(@NotNull @NotNull Consumer<@NotNull PostResult<?>> consumer)
      Adds the Consumer to consume PostResult.
      Parameters:
      consumer - the Consumer to add
      Returns:
      if the consumer has been added to this event bus, returns true, otherwise false
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if this event bus is already closed

    • removeResultConsumer

      boolean removeResultConsumer(@NotNull @NotNull Consumer<@NotNull PostResult<?>> consumer)
      Removes the Consumer to consume PostResult.
      Parameters:
      consumer - the Consumer to remove
      Returns:
      if the consumer has been removed from this event bus, returns true, otherwise false
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if this event bus is already closed
